Posts.Content: Holding your hand as you go through this process. Possibility is that your tumor is benign. If the biopsy is positive for cancer, you will be scheduled for excision, margin probe, harvest of your sentinel lymph node plus a few extras, followed by either IORT or regular three weeks worth of radiation (try to get IORT if your oncology center/hospital offers it), and, if necessary, chemo. Meantime hold the thought that your lump is benign. Worry is giving power to something you don’t want to happen. Best advice: If you do have breast cancer, find out what kinds of cancer support groups and classes are available and enjoy the recovery process with others in the same boat. I love my yoga and QiGong classes and the groups have become such good friends,
Posts.Title: Just told I have breast cancer.
